questions.text: Which dynasty is considered to contain the apex of Chinese poetical history, with poets such as Li Bai and Tu Fu extant?
questions.explanation:
Tang.

	Every educated Chinese person brims with pride when discussing Tang poetry.

questions.text: Which of the following dynasties was the last Chinese dynasty?
questions.explanation:
Qing.

	The Qing dynasty, or Manchu dynasty as it is sometimes known, lasted up until February of 1912, when the boy emperor abdicated his throne.

questions.text: What was the name of the brief dynasty of Wang Mang?
questions.explanation:
Xin.

	The xin, or 'new' dynasty, was not new for long...it only lasted 15 years, from 8 A.D. to 23 A.D.

questions.text: During which Chinese dynasty did the explorer Cheng He make his great expedition?
questions.explanation:
Ming.

	During the early Ming, the emperors were outward reaching, but the later Ming is characterized by isolationism.

questions.text: The Eastern period of this dynasty is known in history by the name 'The Spring and Autumn Period.' To which dynasty is this referring?
questions.explanation:
Zhou.

	The Spring and Autumn Period was the most fecund period in Chinese philosophical history, a hundred philosophical schools flourished.

questions.text: Which of the following is not one of the fabled 'three kingdoms' of Chinese history?
questions.explanation:
Chen.

	Although only in existence for a short time together, the three kingdoms were immortalized in a Chinese classic novel. The three kingdoms came into existence following the later Han, around 220 A.D.

questions.text: Which dynasty is seen as the first to unite China proper?
questions.explanation:
Qin.

	The Qin dynasty was founded in 221 B.C. by Qin Shihuang Di, considered the first emperor of unified China.

questions.text: During which dynasty did China conquer Vietnam, beginning a domination that would last about 1000 years?
questions.explanation:
Han.

	This domination lasted from 111 B.C. to 939 A.D.

questions.text: Which dynasty is the first for which substantial historical evidence exists?
questions.explanation:
Shang.

	The most profound discoveries have been those of dragon bones....tortoise shells and cow scapulas with oracle inscriptions which were heated until cracking, giving the king predictions for many areas of public life.

questions.text: During the period of the Southern Song, what was the name of the Jurchen dynasty that ruled the North?
questions.explanation:
Jin.

	The Jurchen were later supplanted by the Mongols, as were the Song themselves.
